headline: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
description: These are the perfect strawberry daiquiris for a hot summer day. Made with fresh or frozen strawberries, these are so good you'll never buy a mix again.

video.description: Sipping a strawberry daiquiri is synonymous with vacation mode. This frozen cocktail is the perfect drink to make for beach trips, backyard parties, and summer happy hours at home. In this video, learn how to make the best strawberry daiquiri.
video.name: How to Make the Best Strawberry Daiquiri | Summer Cocktail

name: Best Strawberry Daiquiri

recipeInstructions.text: Place frozen strawberries in a blender; add sugar, lemon juice, and lime juice. Pour in rum and lemon-lime beverage, then add ice. Blend until smooth.

review.reviewBody: We added extra strawberries and it was delicious!!!
I thought it was good,added whipped topping.And more rum of coarse.Yummy!
I doubled the lime juice accidentally the first time, it was good either way!

Made this refreshing drink on a hot summer day. Did not have any lemon or lime juice but found it just as refreshing we're simply strawberries a little sugar and rum. Delicious and will definitely make again!

Made exactly as directed (yes, even the 6 cups of ice) and these are fantastic! If you measure out the frozen strawberries as indicated (about 6 strawberries weighed), you need the ice because it’s not enough on it’s own. One could certainly double or triple the strawberry amount to reduce the sugar and ice amount, but I tried this recipe exactly as written and it’s wonderfully spot on. Tastes just like it would at a restaurant. I will be making these again. Thx for the great recipe!
Love it so delicious
Added a little whip cream, extra strawberries and cut down the granulated sugar by 1/4 cup. Fantastic and delicious. Thank you for whoever made this recipe.
Kids and adults alike loved this - made without the rum for everyone.

I used 1/3 cup sugar. Cooked down the strawberries a little while melting the sugar making a mixture. Then allow that to completely chill before mixing the rest. Make sure everything is cold as can be before blending. Add banana for extra flavor!
Made as directed but without the lemon/lime carbonated drink and it was excellent.
Love it! it feels like the number of servings is wrong though. They would be small servings. I scale down to 2 servings for one not very big drink.
Used fresh strawberries instead and it was delicious!
Far too much rum. Had to add double everything else to make up for it. Other than that, the ingredients listed made a great daiquiri
Delish!
Absolutely delicious

This is indeed the best recipe I've ever found. I do, however make a couple of adjustments. 1. I use about 1 lb of strawberries (4 oz is way too little), and 2... I like to add about 1/4 cup of "silver" whiskey, which balances the sweetness very nicely (and adds little more of the booze kick).
Used all lemon juice since we didn't have any limes and also doubled the strawberries and it was delicious
Made a couple changes. Way less ice, 1/4 cup of sugar, a little bit less lemon juice.

Good recipe but a little too tart for me. I melted the sugar with the lime juice on top of my stove in a small saucepan took about 5 minutes, let it cool, while I was loading the other ingredients in blender. I used frozen berries which I let thaw, no soda.
This was so yummy! I'm making it again tonight! I subbed the sugar for agave. Was great!
Delicious!! Not too sweet or overpowering. Refreshing and easy!!!
so good, better then the restaurants.
Love it!!! I felt it needed extra rum so added a full cup to it. That did the trick.

Made with fresh squeezed juice and strawberries - delicious! My husband and I enjoyed thesse on a hot summer night - We forgot to add the lemon-lime soda at first sip, took it to the next level when added.
Love it!
Didn’t add lemon or the soda came out delish
Yummylicious!

I made this exactly as stated by the recipe. The lemon juice and lime juice were overpowering. The strawberry seemed to only provide coloring. If you like a lemon lime daquiri then this is great. I didn't not like this at all.

The consistency of the daquiri was perfect though. It wasn't too thick or too watery.

I think the fault was in me and not the recipe. I only had frozen strawberries and quickly found that had to be defrosted before my blender would blend. Then the strawberries were the sourest I've ever tasted. Going to try this again but with fresh strawberries.
This is SO DELICIOUS!!! Hubby made a sour face, but I loved it.
Excellent but we added more rum and more strawberries.
Most amazing recipe! It's so delicious

I followed the recipe with the only change being use of coconut/pineapple seltzer water in place of the lemon/lime drink. The drink was fabulous. For the second batch I added a banana to the strawberry and it was also delicious. When I used the base recipe again I substituted the lemon with a freshly squeezed orange and still added the lime. This recipe is very versatile and all combinations I have made have been raved about by my party guests!
Turned out great, I love the lime taste! I made 2 servings, about 16 oz. It was the perfect amount for me.

I had company from the U.K. And a gallon bag of fresh/frozen strawberries. I made this cocktail for us in a flash. He was so impressed with how good the drink is, he can't wait to go home and share the recipe. I eye balled the measurements and it was fine.
The strawberry daiquiris were a hit. Everyone loved them. I followed the recipe exactly.
Delicious!!!!!! Big hit

So, the first time ever, I followed the recipe to the tee, and...not so good. Way too much citrus favor, and not sweet enough. I'm going to do it again, as I am on a quest to making the perfect daiquiri. I didn't read the reviews prior to making this, so I'll take some of the suggestions as well, and let you know hoe it comes out.
It came out amazing!!! I made it without the alcohol for the family. Kids loved it.
Wonderful!
I made the recipe as is (I always do before changes) and loved it.
Add 1/2 cup daiquiri mix (Daily's)

Made as written, I give this recipe 4 stars. Next time I make this, I am going to increase the amount of strawberries to at least 5 ounces and I'm going to make a simple syrup with the lime juice, lemon juice and sugar to make sure the sugar is completely dissolved. I blended it for quite a while last time and I still had sugar at the bottom of my glass. I also left out the lemon-lime soda - it didn't seem right to add it - unless you are leaving out the rum, then I would add it in. As far as taste, this was just as good as, if not better than any daiquiri I've ever ordered out... so good!

Main thing is, reverse the amount of frozen strawberris with ice, so it will actually have a strawberry flavor. I used sweetened Roses Lime juice (and no lemon), and Agave syrup instead of sugar. Delicious, and actually tastes like strawberry. Oh, I used a whole cup of Rum! No soda...ugh!
Perfect mix
I also made some changes... Definitely reduced the sugar by half! Love the lemon in addition to the lime, it adds another layer of tropical flavors! Yum. ??
Yum!! Made these last night and everyone loved them. Used fresh strawberries right from the field as that's what I had on hand. Also didn't have lime juice but they were still terrific.
Used fresh strawberries which were chilled but otherwise followed the recipe. Loved it.
Swapped the rum for dissarano!
Very nice sweet and tart balance. I was out of any sort of lemon-lime soda so I substituted Gran Marnier.
I don't like sour so I used half lemon juice and it was still too sour. But...still very yummy.
I used peaches instead of strawberries. No lime juice (out) but added spiced rum along with Bacardi. Yummy.

Grabbed the first recipe that popped up in a search for 'strawberry daquiri.' I used a combination of sweetened key lime juice concentrate and fresh-squeezed lemon juice with frozen strawberries and a splash of diet 7-Up added to the blender at the last moment.. It was the perfect consistency and flavor.. Just enough tartness to stand up to the sweetness of the strawberries & sugar. I am saving this recipe for future use, it's amazing!!
Just the right amount of liquor and tasted great.
Amazing! Used agave instead of sugar and tropical frozen fruit.
It was REALLY hard to make. It didn't say to crush the ice, and I like it with much more soda and lemon juice.
And who makes this without rum?! That's ludicrous! I wouldn't change a thing!

I thought this recipe was great! I've made it twice. The second time I only had about 2 cups of ice so I added more strawberry and it turned out great! I used lemon-lime seltzer water for the carbonated beverage and highly recommend it. My boyfriend thought that the sugar was too gritty the first time so we blended just the sugar and the liquids together first before adding the frozen ingredients

I made a smaller batch of these, and ended up doubling the amount of strawberries and rum, and using superfine sugar instead of table sugar. Other than that, kept everything the same. Really delicious!
Good, but too much lemon/lime.
Loved it!

Very tasty base, although we altered it to a point where some might say I ought not review... Anyhow, we made virgin daiquiris using a total of 1 cup of lemon lime soda, 1/3 cup of standard granulated sugar, 1/4 c of lime juice, 8 ounces of frozen strawberries and 4 1/2 cups of ice/ Great change of pace to accompany dinner.

The whole family loves this recipe! We prepare it without alcohol so the kids can enjoy it as well, then add a little vodka (instead of rum) to our individual adult glasses. We've tried many other recipes lately, but keep coming back to this one!

This gets rave reviews every time I make it! And it doesn't matter whether I use fresh-squeezed lemons/limes or use the pre-squeezed juice in bottles or whether I use fresh or frozen strawberries. The only thing that really makes a difference is using powdered sugar rather than regular, since the regular doesn't dissolve or distribute evenly. I'm also liberal with what 4 oz. of strawberries means to me. I've tried this with raspberries, too, and am looking forward to trying it with mangos. Mmmmm! Thanks for the great recipe!

It is indeed the best strawberry daiquiri I've ever had! I used fresh strawberries, fresh lemon/lime juice and orange-flavored sparkling water ('cause I didn't have any lemon-lime soda) and a tiny bit of peppermint oil. Garnished with a spring of mint and a lime slice.

OMG and don't drink it too fast...I got two or three brain freezes before I slowed down! LOL
I use 151 rum with my recipe, which really gives the daiquiri a nice kick.
For those that want more of a strawberry flavor, omit lemon and lime juice and add some strawberry liqueur. (Don't use strawberry schnapps!)

Pretty delicious. This is the only daiquiri recipe I've ever made, so I don't have much to compare it too. I don't know if all of the ingredients are necessary, like both the lime and lemon juices. I've only ever made it with Captain Morgan, not Malibu. And I add significantly more rum than called for.
Used 1/2 the recipe and replaced fresh strawberries for a whole banana. Amazing. Hint: Bananas are best over ripe!
Wonderful daiquiri recipe! A perfect balance of berry, citrus, and rum. Usually I fiddle with recipes after the first try, but with this one, there's no need.
I will definitely make this again. I read the reviews and doubled the strawberries and reduced th lime/lemon juice - 1 tblspn. lime juice, 2 tblspn lemon juice.

OMG!! I just made a "tester" of this, because I have a picky wife and wasn't sure how it was taste...but WOW!!!!! Absolutely amazing...only thing I changed was I added a little grenadine syrup, more because we like the flavour of it than anything else, lol
soo good, but I made some changes, 4 fresh strawberries, sprite, 2 spoon of sugar. it was just enough for one person.
We loved this! Best homemade drink we've had!
We used 1/2 Stevia and 1/2 sugar, didn't put in the lemon-lime soda, and used fresh strawberries. Also we used less ice (mostly because our blender was maxed out). Yummy!
Yum!
it was okay. not really enough strawberry flavor

Perfect recipe! Big hit at an all girls get together I had recently. I used frozen whole strawberries, I did make a simple syrup and used 1/2 c of that, sweet and sour mix (I had it so I used it), and but the blender on slushie. Everyone loved them and if too sweet, added a squeeze of lime into the individuals glass to suit their taste :-) Make some non-alcoholic ones tonight for our Sunday movie night! Thanks for this recipe!!
I opted out of the lime & lemon juice and just used a lime&lemon carbonated soda I had on hand. Decreased the ice to 4 cubes since my strawberries were already frozen solid through. Perfect!
Quick simple and easy. It is a great recipe that works with other fruit as well. I tried it with peaches and it was awsome.
it tastes more like a strawberry margarita than a daiquiri. too much lime flavoring. wasn't good.
verry lemony

I made this for my friend's birthday party, another friend made Vodka crush, everyone thought the Vodka crush was great until they tried my Daiquiris. After that everyone put the crush down and never touched it again. My small party of 5 insisted I make 3 more batches and raved about it all over facebook. This cocktail is an epic win ;D

This was very delicious. I used a liberal amount of fresh strawberries - almost an entire carton as they are very cheap in-season. I also mistakenly bought frozen limeade concentrate instead of soda. When I made the limeade up, it worked fine. My friend who is not much of a drinker requested additional rum. We almost doubled the amount of rum (bottoms up!), and the drink still masked the flavor very well. I would HIGHLY recommend, but I would also highly recommend buying FRESH strawberries for this drink.

I'm giving this less than 5 stars, because I'm mildy and don't think I made it right. I 'eye-balled' the ice (how do you measure ice anyway?) and felt there was much too much ice. I also cracked my blender and half the ingredients came out and I re-did it. And my blender really sucks and is old. But despite all that, my frosty concoction turned out pretty good! It could use more strawberry taste, but if I didn't put in so much ice... :)

Very tasty. I did cut down the amount of lemon and lime for my own personal preference. I also cut down the amount of alcohol. Do not let the cocktail fool you, even with a little less alcohol this packs a punch and it's so delicious you won't realize the amount of alcohol you're consuming!
mmm
i followed the suggestion about fresh strawberries and i added alittle extra ice and some fruit concentrate that was made specially for daiquiri. It came out wonderfully. ^_^
This is a great little daiquiri recipe! I made 2 pitchers, one for the kids and one for the grown ups :) Didn't have to change anything so...bonus!

These were really good and went down so easily! I didn't follow the measurements exactly, but it was probably close. I used Coconut Rum instead of regular and oh my goodness! I highly recommend you try it that way. It was the perfect amount of sweetness for me, without adding any sugar. Will definitely make them again.

This was a great recipe! I was attracted to it for it's use of fresh lemon and lime juice. I doubled the amount of strawberries and made in 2 batches. This will is surely a recipe I will use again and again.
I have been using this recipe for several years now and for the New Year we are turning to it again. I really love the simplicity of it and its comes out nice and smooth, not too fruity.
excellent taste and so fresh tasting. liked the fact that you really couldn't taste the rum.
Good drink-followed direction exactly and was refreshing.

These are great! I only had fresh strawberries, and I think I used more than the recipe called for...I also did not have lime juice. Instead of Sprite I used a strawberry flavored calorie free sparkling water, which I highly recommend! I wasn't going to add it at all but without the liquid my blender couldn't handle it. Excellent strawberry flavor :)
Drink was okay. A little more hassle to make than other good rum drinks, due to having to use the blender.
amazing just enought of everything!
Wonderful! I made it in 2 half batches (like others suggested.) I even made one using peaches instead of strawberries. It was delicious.
It was delicious!!! I accidently added 1/2 cup of 7up but it was still great!!
